result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard Allen Michalski Jr

records.addlTxt: Justice Point Pretrial Services Discharge Report received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report, filed.

Defendant Richard Allen Michalski Jr in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Richard Allen Michalski Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Status Conference held.  For reasons placed on the record, Court joins 22CM541, 22CM1392, 22CM1782, 22CM2433 for trial.  Due to Court's scheduling, Court will schedule case for jury trial with defendant's other cases.  Case adjourned, Br. 13.  Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Jury trial scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
All previously ordered conditions of bail remain in full effect.

Defendant Richard Allen Michalski Jr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Richard Allen Michalski Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for bail/bond hearing. Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Case adjourned for status in Branch 13.
Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Court ordered no contact with SBM, SAM, AH, JH, or DCB
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3. Defendant to be monitored by portable breathalyzers and drug testing. Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Richard Allen Michalski Jr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont appeared by video for Richard Allen Michalski Jr. Attorney Sara Beth Hill appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 13.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Branch 13.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
